author: A_Brickset_user
title: Its great!
review:
What a great belville set! As belville sets go it has alot of nice transparent peices and its really fun to play with!
My only complaint would be that I think they should have made it bigger...but then it would have cost more and it was expensive enough as it is...its not a cheap set but worth it if you really like belville.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Nice set for 4-6 year old girls
review:
I've been pushing Lego at my two daughters for a couple of years with no success (cuz they are too young, duh), but this set finally got their attention. Big pieces for weak little hands, lots of cute girlish stuff, and good support for the winter castle on the Lego web site (games and stories that the kids actually like to play). 

Obviously juniorized but that's OK for the target audience. 

The selection of little parts like plates, food, goblets, diamonds, drawers, etc is excellent for people who want to create detailed Lego MOCs, but I wouldn't spend all that money  just for those little bits.
